text: Extreme winter heat and dry, whipping winds fueled what became the second-largest wildfire on record in Texas on Wednesday. The Smokehouse Creek fire spread across half a million acres in less than two days, prompting harrowing evacuations and cutting off escapes from small towns and ranches.

Lee is the seventh Category 5 storm globally in 2023. Between 1990-2022, the mean number of Cat 5 storms/year was 5.3. 1997 had the most Cat 5s in one year with 12. The most recent strong El Niño year, 2015, had 8 Cat 5 storms by this time, mostly in the West Pacific, and ended w/ a total of 9. #wx
